danfulea.utils.gadgets

Class ElegantClockPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • danfulea.utils.gadgets.ElegantClockPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ElegantClockPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The panel containing the elegant clock. Based on tutorial/example freely available on the web.
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 06 AUG. 2016
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getDiamond

        java.awt.Polygon getDiamond(int seconds,
                            double angle,
                            double forwards,
                            double backwards,
                            double sideways)
        Diamond shape based on position around the clock (for major thicks - hours, minutes - as an option) used for internal computation.
        Parameters:
        seconds - seconds
        angle - angle
        forwards - forwards param
        backwards - backward param
        sideways - sideways param
        Returns:
        the diamond shape polygon object

      • getHand

        java.awt.Polygon getHand(double seconds,
                         double forwards,
                         double backwards,
                         double sideways)
        Parameters:
        seconds - seconds
        forwards - forwards
        backwards - backwards
        sideways - sideways
        Returns:
        the polygon shape depicted clock ticks (default second ticks - shapes around the clock where hands point to)
